de.mrapp.android.preference.view

Class NumberPicker

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.widget.NumberPicker
      • de.mrapp.android.preference.view.NumberPicker

  • public class NumberPicker
extends android.widget.NumberPicker
    A custom view, which is extended from the view android.widget.NumberPicker in order to provide a setter method, which allows to set the color of the number picker's selectionDivider.
    Since:
    1.1.0

                    Context context,
                    @Nullable
                    AttributeSet attributeSet,
                    @AttrRes
                    int defaultStyle)
        Creates a new number picker.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the number picker, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the view, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes are available
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this view. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource

      • NumberPicker

        public NumberPicker(@NonNull
                    Context context,
                    @Nullable
                    AttributeSet attributeSet,
                    @AttrRes
                    int defaultStyle,
                    @StyleRes
                    int defaultStyleResource)
        Creates a new number picker.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the number picker, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the view, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes are available
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this view. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource
        defaultStyleResource - A resource identifier of a style resource that supplies default values for the view, used only if the default style is 0 or can not be found in the theme. Can be 0 to not look for defaults
